header: 1 Cri.M.A.No.102 of 2019 (Exh.1) Order passed below Exh.1 in Cri.M.A.No.102 of 2019. (CNR No.MHST01­000513­2019)

background.text: 01. The applicant, namely, Jameer Mustak Shaikh by this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure prayed to made absolute interim anticipatory bail granted below Exh.4 in C.R.No.26 of 2019 registered with Lonand Police Station under Section 188, 272, 273, 328 r/w.34 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860, under Section 26(2)(i), 26(2)(iv) r/w.27(3)(e) & 30(2)(a) of Food Safety and Standards Act and r/w. Rule 3.1.7 of Food Safety and Standards Rules and under Section 59 of Food Safety and Standards Act.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under section 188, 272, 273, 328 r/w.34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: 02. From the contents of complaint of Rahul Mahadev Khandagale dated 31.01.2019 in C.R.No.26 of 2019 of Lonand Police Station, it reveals that, accused by name Nazimuddin Jainaddin Shaikh was found transporting prohibited article in vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. Accused Nazimuddin Shaikh told that, he is owner of vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. On perusal of RC book, it came to the notice of Police agency that, Prakash Nandabhau Dudhade is owner of above mentioned vehicle.

argumentSentences.text: From the contents of complaint of Rahul Mahadev Khandagale dated 31.01.2019 in C.R.No.26 of 2019 of Lonand Police Station, it reveals that, accused by name Nazimuddin Jainaddin Shaikh was found transporting prohibited article in vehicle No.
Accused Nazimuddin Shaikh told that, he is owner of vehicle No.
On perusal of RC book, it came to the notice of Police agency that, Prakash Nandabhau Dudhade is owner of above mentioned vehicle.

arguments.text: 03. From the contents of application, it reveals that, according to applicant, complaint is lodged against Nazimuddin Jainaddin Shaikh and owner of vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. Applicant has no concern with the alleged crime. The alleged crime was registered without written sanction of Commissioner of Food. The Police officer registered the F.I.R. without ascertaining the truth.

argumentSentences.text: From the contents of application, it reveals that, according to applicant, complaint is lodged against Nazimuddin Jainaddin Shaikh and owner of vehicle No.
Applicant has no concern with the alleged crime.
The alleged crime was registered without written sanction of Commissioner of Food.
The Police officer registered the F.I.R. without ascertaining the truth.

arguments.text: 04. From the say of learned A.P.P. at Exh.7, it reveals that, applicant is involved in illegal activities prohibited by State Government. Investigation is in progress. If applicant is released on bail, he will misuse his liberty.

argumentSentences.text: From the say of learned A.P.P. at Exh.7, it reveals that, applicant is involved in illegal activities prohibited by State Government.
Investigation is in progress.
If applicant is released on bail, he will misuse his liberty.

arguments.text: 05. Heard learned Advocate for applicant and learned A.P.P. It is vehemently argued by learned Advocate for applicant that, the interim protection granted to applicant by passing order below Exh.4 needs to be continued.

argumentSentences.text: Heard learned Advocate for applicant and learned A.P.P.
It is vehemently argued by learned Advocate for applicant that, the interim protection granted to applicant by passing order below Exh.4 needs to be continued.

arguments.text: 06. Per contra, it is vehemently argued by learned A.P.P. that, as investigation is in progress, interim protection granted to accused cannot be continued.

argumentSentences.text: Per contra, it is vehemently argued by learned A.P.P. that, as investigation is in progress, interim protection granted to accused cannot be continued.

arguments.text: 07. From the order of Additional Sessions Judge, Satara dated 11/02/2019, it reveals that, it was observed by the Additional Sessions Judge, Satara that, applicant is the owner of vehicle and his custodial presence was not needed, as such interim protection was granted to applicant. From xerox copy of R.C. book filed at Exh.10/1, it reveals that, the xerox copy of R.C. book is delivered to Police by applicant. Admittedly, from the xerox copy of R.C. book, it reveals that, applicant is owner of vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. Say of learned A.P.P. not indicates that, applicant not co­operated with Police or misused his liberty due to interim protection granted to him by the Court. Hence, I am of the view that, the interim protection granted to applicant needs to be continued on some conditions. Hence, I proceed to pass following order.

argumentSentences.text: From the order of Additional Sessions Judge, Satara dated 11/02/2019, it reveals that, it was observed by the Additional Sessions Judge, Satara that, applicant is the owner of vehicle and his custodial presence was not needed, as such interim protection was granted to applicant.
From xerox copy of R.C. book filed at Exh.10/1, it reveals that, the xerox copy of R.C. book is delivered to Police by applicant.
Admittedly, from the xerox copy of R.C. book, it reveals that, applicant is owner of vehicle No.
Say of learned A.P.P. not indicates that, applicant not co­operated with Police or misused his liberty due to interim protection granted to him by the Court.
Hence, I am of the view that, the interim protection granted to applicant needs to be continued on some conditions.
Hence, I proceed to pass following order.

order.text: O R D E R 1. Anticipatory bail application of applicant, namely, Jameer Mustak Shaikh is hereby allowed and order passed below Exh.4 dated 11/02/2019 is made absolute. 2. In the event of arrest of applicant Jameer Mustak Shaikh, he be released on bail in C.R.No.26 of 2019 registered with Lonand Police Station, Tal. Khandala, District Satara, on his furnishing P.R. of Rs.15,000/­ with one surety of like amount on following terms and conditions. 3. The applicant is directed to attend Lonand Police Station on every Sunday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 4. The applicant shall not influence the prosecution witnesses or tamper with the evidence. 5. The applicant shall co­operate with the investigating agency and not to misuse his liberty by any manner. 6. If it is noticed that, applicant is disobeying the condition by non attending the Police Station, that should be the ground for cancellation of bail of applicant.

footer: Satara. Date : 09.04.2019. (N.D.Khose) Additional Sessions Judge, Satara.
processedText:
1 Cri.M.A.No.102 of 2019 (Exh.1) Order passed below Exh.1 in Cri.M.A.No.102 of 2019. (CNR No.MHST01­000513­2019) 
---header-ends---
01. The applicant, namely, Jameer Mustak Shaikh by this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure prayed to made absolute interim anticipatory bail granted below Exh.4 in C.R.No.26 of 2019 registered with Lonand Police Station under Section 188, 272, 273, 328 r/w.34 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860, under Section 26(2)(i), 26(2)(iv) r/w.27(3)(e) & 30(2)(a) of Food Safety and Standards Act and r/w. Rule 3.1.7 of Food Safety and Standards Rules and under Section 59 of Food Safety and Standards Act. 
---background-ends---
02. From the contents of complaint of Rahul Mahadev Khandagale dated 31.01.2019 in C.R.No.26 of 2019 of Lonand Police Station, it reveals that, accused by name Nazimuddin Jainaddin Shaikh was found transporting prohibited article in vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. Accused Nazimuddin Shaikh told that, he is owner of vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. On perusal of RC book, it came to the notice of Police agency that, Prakash Nandabhau Dudhade is owner of above mentioned vehicle. 
---argument-ends---
03. From the contents of application, it reveals that, according to applicant, complaint is lodged against Nazimuddin Jainaddin Shaikh and owner of vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. Applicant has no concern with the alleged crime. The alleged crime was registered without written sanction of Commissioner of Food. The Police officer registered the F.I.R. without ascertaining the truth. 
---argument-ends---
04. From the say of learned A.P.P. at Exh.7, it reveals that, applicant is involved in illegal activities prohibited by State Government. Investigation is in progress. If applicant is released on bail, he will misuse his liberty. 
---argument-ends---
05. Heard learned Advocate for applicant and learned A.P.P. It is vehemently argued by learned Advocate for applicant that, the interim protection granted to applicant by passing order below Exh.4 needs to be continued. 
---argument-ends---
06. Per contra, it is vehemently argued by learned A.P.P. that, as investigation is in progress, interim protection granted to accused cannot be continued. 
---argument-ends---
07. From the order of Additional Sessions Judge, Satara dated 11/02/2019, it reveals that, it was observed by the Additional Sessions Judge, Satara that, applicant is the owner of vehicle and his custodial presence was not needed, as such interim protection was granted to applicant. From xerox copy of R.C. book filed at Exh.10/1, it reveals that, the xerox copy of R.C. book is delivered to Police by applicant. Admittedly, from the xerox copy of R.C. book, it reveals that, applicant is owner of vehicle No. MH16­AE­9158. Say of learned A.P.P. not indicates that, applicant not co­operated with Police or misused his liberty due to interim protection granted to him by the Court. Hence, I am of the view that, the interim protection granted to applicant needs to be continued on some conditions. Hence, I proceed to pass following order. 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R 1. Anticipatory bail application of applicant, namely, Jameer Mustak Shaikh is hereby allowed and order passed below Exh.4 dated 11/02/2019 is made absolute. 2. In the event of arrest of applicant Jameer Mustak Shaikh, he be released on bail in C.R.No.26 of 2019 registered with Lonand Police Station, Tal. Khandala, District Satara, on his furnishing P.R. of Rs.15,000/­ with one surety of like amount on following terms and conditions. 3. The applicant is directed to attend Lonand Police Station on every Sunday in between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 4. The applicant shall not influence the prosecution witnesses or tamper with the evidence. 5. The applicant shall co­operate with the investigating agency and not to misuse his liberty by any manner. 6. If it is noticed that, applicant is disobeying the condition by non attending the Police Station, that should be the ground for cancellation of bail of applicant. 
---order-ends---
Satara. Date : 09.04.2019. (N.D.Khose) Additional Sessions Judge, Satara.
